intro: Guettardella surigaoensis, commonly known as the Surigao spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a waxy texture, while its stems are slender and often creeping. Guettardella surigaoensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
